title: Sydney Cafe Hostage Siege

embed.description: Channel 7 DANIEL MUNOZ/Fairfax Australia PETER RAE/Fairfax Australia Peter Rae Channel 7 DANIEL MUNOZ/Fairfax Australia JAMES ROBERTSON/Fairfax Australia About 10 people are being held hostage in the Lindt Chocolate Cafe in Sydney's Martin Place. A person has been seen inside the cafe waving a flag associated with Islamist and jihadist movements.

body:
Happening right now. I'm from NZ but still, I feel the tension from Australia already

Those with friends or connections who may be stuck in the Lindt Chocolate Cafe, my heart goes out to you.

replies.body: I hope it's not a false flag

> [{quoted}](name=I Really Irelia,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=uZyOvnRI,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2014-12-15T04:35:33.262+0000)
> I hope it's not a false flag

As convenient a time it is for a false flag it better not be!

> [{quoted}](name=lols,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=uZyOvnRI,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2014-12-15T04:37:05.599+0000)
> As convenient a time it is for a false flag it better not be!

7 news reports are biased, exaggerated and fear mongering. The ABC coverage seems fact based. 

For example - 7 news feed had a random civilian woman talking about 'if it was her she'd hit more than one place' and 'these people don't work alone' as if she was some kind of expert and allowed it into the live feed when things were getting boring.

Coincidentally 7 news/fairfax is owned by Kerry Stokes, who supports labor and labor are announcing a deficit and also trying to pass intrusive "Anti Terror" laws (Meta data, if you haven't seen the hilarious video of an old git trying to explain meta data click [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Hw1ryLGs2ws)).

I call false flag.

> [{quoted}](name=Spidicus,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=uZyOvnRI,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2014-12-15T05:53:08.708+0000)

> Coincidentally 7 news/fairfax is owned by Kerry Stokes, who supports labor and labor are announcing a deficit and also trying to pass intrusive "Anti Terror" laws (Meta data, if you haven't seen the hilarious video of an old git trying to explain meta data click [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Hw1ryLGs2ws)).
> 
> I call false flag.

Are mistaking Labor for Liberals? Cause im pretty sure this is a Liberal Policy...
And Liberals Announcing $40Billion deficit...
And Liberals are pushing the MetaData Bill...
and George Brandis is Liberal... and a absolute fool.

Do you even know who your voting for?

> [{quoted}](name=TerenceMckenna2g,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=uZyOvnRI,comment-id=0003000000000000,timestamp=2014-12-15T08:06:57.272+0000)

> [{quoted}](name=lols,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=uZyOvnRI,comment-id=00030000000000000000,timestamp=2014-12-15T08:24:32.902+0000)
> I vote greens because my dad wanted me to vote for them least.

Quality. I Guess he votes Lib/Nats then?

And here i am making sure i vote for the guy who is the lowest rated on most of the pamphlets i get.

I felt good leaving the election having done nothing useful.
Heard about this. A friend of mine was going into the city, was warned just in time.

Thank you. I have a couple friends still in lock down. But I also have friends who have already been evacuated from the vicinity. Thank you for your concern Strider Hiryu and I too give my deepest sympathies to those with loved ones involved. Stay strong.

Oh cool, I walk past that building my way to uni.

Is it bad that I don't care about this incident at all?

> [{quoted}](name=Justify,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=uZyOvnRI,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2014-12-15T08:41:09.529+0000)
> **
> 
> Stfu scrub, you just  say sh*t like this so everyone on the boards thinks that you actually give a f*ck, why would anyone who has connections with people in this incident visit the LoL oce boards anyways? Condolences are meaningless from nobodies, does anyone involved in this incident even give a F that some scrub in NZ gave their condolences? What impact does it have? None.
> 
> Anyone which goes on the oce boards and says sh*t like that is obviously attention seeking, it is like when Paul Walker died, do the condolences from some randoms really help the situation? It is all for the status.
> 
> "LOOOK AT ME, I CARE WHAT IS HAPPENING, OH POOR PEOPLE SO SAD WHAT IS HAPPENING, MI HART GOES OUT TO U GUISE, OH RLY HOPE U GET BETTER, OH REST IN PIECE SO SAD ;'("

Its funny cause i actual went to school with a guy whos now a impromptu negotiator due to him knowing one of the hostages. That and the AFP/ASIO have been taking down my facebook posts regarding the matter. Inb4 this gets deleted. Im not even kidding
What's he been saying? And what have you said which was deleted?

> [{quoted}](name=Shrewd,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=uZyOvnRI,comment-id=000700010000,timestamp=2014-12-15T10:08:55.630+0000)
> What's he been saying? And what have you said which was deleted?

i said a lot of %%%%, most of it was specifically speculation about government involvement. ASIO didnt take kindly for me expressing my opinion, and my right to political free speech, the only type of free speech we have in australia. Thats right, we dont have a constitution/bill of rights that states we have the right to freedom of speech/expression, only implied political speech/expression.

Attached is buddies statement.

> [{quoted}](name=Justify,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=uZyOvnRI,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2014-12-15T08:41:09.529+0000)

Condolences are meaningless from nobodies, does anyone involved in this incident even give a F that some scrub in NZ gave their condolences? What impact does it have? None.

This guy...

Imagine you're them.

Imagine you have a gun held at your head.

You don't even know how scary it is.

i dont even know anybody in there and ive been in horror all day, every ozzy who knows about it is tense right now, its nice to know that even though theres nothing others can do that you're thinking of us, thanks for the shout out dude, have a good day :)

Friend of mine was in the building opposite. They were evacuated by police a few hours ago. So far, 5 hostages have escaped the situation. You can check here for a consolidated account of what is going on: http://www.reddit.com/live/u2pwph99rvy6

Hopefully the situation turns out ok.

Update: NSW Police are calling this a terrorist situation.
Glad im not only person thinking False Flag... You know, with the $40Billion budget deficit being announced, and the Indigenous and Remote Eye Health Service also not get its funding renewed.

It is just a messed up situation. This is something you would never see in Australia. I hope the Riot's office isn't anywhere near it. I just feel so sorry for the people wanting to get some chocolate in the morning.

> [{quoted}](name=Unorthodox Meta,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=uZyOvnRI,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2014-12-15T04:13:48.468+0000)
> It is just a messed up situation. This is something you would never see in Australia. I hope the Riot's office isn't anywhere near it. I just feel so sorry for the people wanting to get some chocolate in the morning.

It is, and in fact as selfish as this seems, Australia already has terrorism problems, and I'm worrying for my own country too; if countries even as far as Australia now has terrorism, what about New Zealand?

My father always said: Terrorists love New Zealand, it's far from any other country AND New Zealand hasn't really offended Muslims anyway (generalising terrorism to Muslims, really sorry but I had to) so New Zealand is a great place for terrorists to stay. Because of this, chances are, New Zealand won't get terrorised anytime soon since terrorists have no reason to.

But Australia? I've heard you guys have been up to some anti-terrorism stuff recently, probably what provoked this act today.
